Ask HN: How to Avoid Geotargetted Content?
text:
Even when I am logged into a Google account I am bombarded with content in the wrong language.

In Google maps, I am always shown the wrong currency when Google wants to book me a hotel room. The help page for this is useless and out of date. At least show me a major international currency.

Why would I book a hotel in Europe with a 3rd world currency I don't bank in? It ruins the whole sales experience and makes me focus on how terrible these platforms have become.

On YouTube, I have logged in and explicitly set the country and language. YouTube search results are mostly useless and often in the wrong language. Even for a simple query like "news". Worse yet, the language of results is often totally unrelated to my current region.

Advertisements are similarly incomprehensible. I'd be disappointed if I were buying these ads.

On Google search, although many results are in English, it is a particular flavor of English from authors in the region. I'd rather have the most relevant content, not the content Google presumes to align with my identity or the region I'm in.

It is enough to navigate foreign languages outside of the home. When using the computer it would be nice to have a comfort zone in English. Unfortunately Google thinks it knows better. It wasn't always this way.

Spotify is similar. Twitter has the same issues.

How can I have a basic English language experience without using a VPN?

Ask HN: Plain text languages that compile to slideshows or movies?
text:
I'm working on a new language for data journalists building timeline/movie stories like these: https://www.nytimes.com/2022/12/22/video/russia-ukraine-bucha-massacre-takeaways.html

Has anyone seen any hand written DSLs that compile to a movie file, powerpoint, HTML presentation, et cetera?

I want to allow people to make movies by hand first, rather than by a GUI tool like iMovie or PowerPoint (though building a GUI for these files will be very easy later on).

Here'a snippet of my work in progress (that generates a javascript/html/css presentation):

    clear
    
    0 * audio walking.mpeg
    
    0 3 overlay This video includes scences of graphic violenece from the outset.
    
    0 * video walking.mpeg
    
    15.1 * audio someOfMost.mp4
    
    20 * video birdsEye.mpeg
    
    * * video scene1.mpeg
    * * video scene2.mpeg
    * * video scene3.mpeg
    * * video scene4.mpeg
    * * video scene5.mpeg
    * * video scene6.mpeg
    
    clear
